00014 #ifndef ULIBDBG_OBJECTDB_H
00015 #define ULIBDBG_OBJECTDB_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/base/base.h>
00018 
00019 /* =======================================================================================================================
00020 A mechanism that allow all objects to be registered with a central in-memory "database" that can dump the state of all
00021 live objects. The macros which allow easy registration and removal of objects to be dumped (U_REGISTER_OBJECT and
00022 U_UNREGISTER_OBJECT) are turned into no-ops by compiling with the DEBUG macro undefined. This allows usage to be removed
00023 in "release mode" builds without changing code. There are several interesting aspects to this design:
00024 
00025 1. It uses the External Polymorphism pattern to avoid having to derive all classes from a common base class that has
00026    virtual methods (this is crucial to avoid unnecessary overhead). In addition, there is no additional space added
00027    to objects (this is crucial to maintain binary layout compatibility)
00028 
00029 2. This mechanism can be conditionally compiled in order to completely disable this feature entirely. Moreover, by
00030    using macros there are relatively few changes to code
00031 
00032 3. This mechanism copes with single-inheritance hierarchies of dumpable classes. In such cases we typically want only
00033    one dump, corresponding to the most derived instance. Note, however, that this scheme doesn't generalize to work
00034    with multiple-inheritance or virtual base classes
00035 ========================================================================================================================== */
00036 
00042 class U_NO_EXPORT UObjectDumpable {
00043 public:
00044 
00045         // Info on object
00046 
00047         const char* name_file;
00048         const char* name_class;
00049         const char* name_function;
00050         const void* ptr_object; // Pointer to the object that is being stored
00051         int         num_line, level;
00052         uint32_t    cnt, size_object;
00053 
00054         // Constructor
00055 
00056                                 UObjectDumpable(int lv, const char* name, const void* ptr) : name_class(name), ptr_object(ptr), level(lv) {}
00057         virtual ~UObjectDumpable()                                                                                         {}
00058 
00059         virtual const char* dump() const = 0; // This pure virtual method must be filled in by a subclass.
00060 };
00061 
00070 template <class Concrete> class U_NO_EXPORT UObjectDumpable_Adapter : public UObjectDumpable {
00071 public:
00072 
00073         // Initialization and termination methods
00074 
00075         UObjectDumpable_Adapter(int level, const char* name_class, const Concrete* object) : UObjectDumpable(level, name_class, object)
00076                 {
00077                 U_INTERNAL_TRACE("UObjectDumpable_Adapter::UObjectDumpable_Adapter(%u,%s,%p)", level, name_class, object)
00078 
00079                 UObjectDumpable::size_object = sizeof(Concrete) - sizeof(void*); // - U_MEMORY_TEST...
00080 
00081                 U_INTERNAL_PRINT("this = %p", this)
00082                 }
00083 
00084         ~UObjectDumpable_Adapter()
00085                 {
00086                 U_INTERNAL_TRACE("UObjectDumpable_Adapter::~UObjectDumpable_Adapter()", 0)
00087 
00088                 U_INTERNAL_PRINT("this = %p", this)
00089                 }
00090 
00091         // Concrete dump method (simply delegates to the 'dump()' method of class Concrete)
00092 
00093         virtual const char* dump() const { return ((const Concrete*)ptr_object)->dump(true); }
00094 };
00095 
00101 class U_NO_EXPORT UObjectDB {
00102 public:
00103 
00104         static int  U_EXPORT fd, level_active;
00105         static bool U_EXPORT flag_new_object;
00106         static bool U_EXPORT flag_ulib_object;
00107 
00108         static void close();
00109         static void initFork();
00110         static void init(bool flag, bool info);
00111 
00112         static void U_EXPORT   registerObject(UObjectDumpable* dumper); // Add the 'dumper' to the list of registered objects
00113         static void U_EXPORT unregisterObject(const void* ptr_object);  // Use 'ptr_object' to locate and remove the
00114                                                                                                                                                                                  // associated 'dumper' from the list of
00115                                                                                                                                                                                  // registered objects
00116 
00117         // Iterates through the entire set of registered objects and dumps their state
00118 
00119         static void              dumpObjects();
00120         static void              dumpObject(const UObjectDumpable* dumper);
00121         static uint32_t dumpObject(char* buffer, uint32_t n, bPFpcpv check_object);
00122 
00123 private:
00124         static char*    file_ptr;
00125         static char*    file_mem;
00126         static char*    file_limit;
00127         static uint32_t file_size;
00128 
00129         static uint32_t n;
00130         static const UObjectDumpable** vec_obj_live;
00131 
00132         static void _write(const struct iovec* iov, int n) U_NO_EXPORT;
00133         static bool addObjLive(const UObjectDumpable* dumper) U_NO_EXPORT;
00134         static bool printObjLive(const UObjectDumpable* dumper) U_NO_EXPORT;
00135         static int  compareDumper(const void* dumper1, const void* dumper2) U_NO_EXPORT;
00136 };
